column4: anyone got any suggestions on closing those open ports on my machine?
how can i get rid of that though..
doesn't cups open that port, and if so i can't print without cups?
do i need to run the cups service to print?
Note that cups doesn't open that port. it only listens on it, on the 127.0.0.1 address.
By default, NOTHING is available from the outside.
What does netstat say they are?
'strace' can connect to a process and trace exactly what calls it makes (and their params)
probably more trouble than its worth. Suffice to say, unless you explicitly install say ssh, apache or a mail server, the system will not be listening on outside networks.
It's installed by default, coz lots of people are. You're free to remove or disable it.
If you think it's worth it.
